page.title: 15S. Concerns in Stallingboro'
page.content: Services available for the elderly in the village include the following: Meals on Wheels: these are brought by volunteer drivers from a centre three miles away and are available one per week. A social services bus takes elderly housebound people to a day centre at Immingham one afternoon a week. A mobile chiropody unit comes to the village once per month. The Council's village plan proposes to develop the village considerably, doubling the present population. Recent developments have provided for the elderly and the newly married. It is felt that family houses are needed, to encourage growing families to stay in the village, to give stability and encourage a good community spirit. There is also concern that any growth should be gradual, so that newcomers integrate with the existing community.
